instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3302: What is 820-3302? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: imac 21.5" late 2012 slow from shrapnel
threads.message:
runs slow after lady cut the stand down and got metal shavings all over the place. i cleaned all the shavings out and didn't see anything wrong per say but i didn't at board that close like under a scope. took me a while to figure out, but ASD gives me CPU proximity TCOp temp sensor error.  error SMC IO failed.
is that a thermistor on the logicboard? or now that i'm thinking about it maybe flying shrapnel damaged the smc line somewhere?
finishing running asd now, everything else looks fine

threads.title: imac 21.5" late 2012 slow from shrapnel
threads.message: Do you have the 820 number for this one?

threads.title: imac 21.5" late 2012 slow from shrapnel
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

looks like there's only 3 choices, a cap the thermistor, and smc
<TRANSISTOR>Q5512</TRANSISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C5512</CAPACITOR>

no physical damage I can see
maybe a shard touched and shorted the cap?

can't seem to find that cap on any laptop board donors, so will have to order from digikey i guess
thermistor on some retina boards

you think it worth trying to replace those two parts or no?

threads.title: imac 21.5" late 2012 slow from shrapnel
threads.message: Is this the only error ASD gives or are there more? Make sure to continue on error. I doubt <TRANSISTOR>Q5512</TRANSISTOR>/<CAPACITOR>C5512</CAPACITOR> is dead, <CHIP>U5500</CHIP> is a better suspect or still shavings around there. Give the board a soak in the bath tub and blow it dry with compressed air and throw it in the oven to dry it out.

threads.title: imac 21.5" late 2012 slow from shrapnel
threads.message: yes only error, i did continue on error

threads.title: imac 21.5" late 2012 slow from shrapnel
threads.message: Clean up around <CHIP>U5500</CHIP>/<TRANSISTOR>Q5512</TRANSISTOR> and replace if still an issue.
